 pandas

fsaintjacques commented on issue #4784: ARROW-5805: [Python] Dockerize (add to docker-compose) Python Travis CI job
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4784#issuecomment-509318691
 
 
   @wesm the `cpp-ci` image found in ARROW-5803 does not use conda, do you want me to convert this python image to avoid conda _or_ tackle [ARROW-5804](https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5804) which is cpp with conda.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

fsaintjacques commented on issue #4784: ARROW-5805: [Python] Dockerize (add to docker-compose) Python Travis CI job
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4784#issuecomment-509318691
 
 
   @wesm the `cpp-ci` image found in ARROW-5803 does not use conda, do you want me to convert this python image to avoid conda _or_ tackle [ARROW-5804](https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5804) which is cpp with conda.
   
   On this subject, I think we should have most tests conda-less with system/bundled dependencies, and have a single CI entry test with conda (both C++ and python). 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

fsaintjacques commented on issue #4784: ARROW-5805: [Python] Dockerize (add to docker-compose) Python Travis CI job
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4784#issuecomment-509318691
 
 
   @wesm the `cpp-ci` image found in ARROW-5803 does not use conda, do you want me to convert this python image to avoid conda _or_ tackle [ARROW-5804](https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5804) which is cpp with conda.
   
   On this subject, I think we should have most tests conda-less with system/bundled dependencies, and have a single CI entry test with conda (both C++ and python). This will be more reflective on how new developers and package maintainers experience the build.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #4784: ARROW-5805: [Python] Dockerize (add to docker-compose) Python Travis CI job
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4784#issuecomment-509321172
 
 
   @fsaintjacques Yes I think that we should have a combined C++/Python docker-compose entry that uses dependencies from conda
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

fsaintjacques commented on issue #4784: ARROW-5805: [Python] Dockerize (add to docker-compose) Python Travis CI job
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4784#issuecomment-509322142
 
 
   My suggestion also imply de-confa-ying the other images (since the base `arrow:cpp` is relying on conda), is the community fine with this (@xhochy, @kszucs)?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

fsaintjacques commented on issue #4784: ARROW-5805: [Python] Dockerize (add to docker-compose) Python Travis CI job
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4784#issuecomment-509322142
 
 
   My suggestion also imply de-confa-ying the other images (since the base `arrow:cpp` is relying on conda), is the community fine with this (@xhochy, @kszucs)?
   
   Note that this patch was initially implemented replacing cpp by removing conda, I ended up using `cpp-ci` instead to minimize the breaking changes.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

xhochy commented on issue #4784: ARROW-5805: [Python] Dockerize (add to docker-compose) Python Travis CI job
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4784#issuecomment-509324739
 
 
   > My suggestion also imply de-confa-ying the other images (since the base `arrow:cpp` is relying on conda), is the community fine with this (@xhochy, @kszucs)?
   > 
   > Note that this patch was initially implemented replacing cpp by removing conda, I ended up using `cpp-ci` instead to minimize the breaking changes.
   
   Actually we should try to keep `conda` in most images as this is the ecosystem we can control best and it is our recommendation for the setup for Python users, our currently most popular user base.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/.travis.yml#L118

The existing Python Dockerfiles should be expanded to test all of the things that are being tested currently in Travis CI.
fields.summary: [Python] Dockerize (add to docker-compose) Python Travis CI job

comments.body: This is now solved with Github Actions.
